HFpEF: heart failure with preserved ejection fraction
HFrEF: heart failure with reduced ejection fraction
5in1(DTaP-Hib-IPV): diphtheria, tetanus, acellular pertussis, inactivated polio and Haemophilus influenzae type b conjugate vaccine
6in1(DTaP-IPV-Hib-HepB): diphtheria, tetanus, acellular pertussis, hepatitis B, inactivated polio and Haemophilus influenzae type b conjugate vaccine
ACOS: asthma-chronic obstructive pulmonary disease overlap syndrome
adCHF: acute decompensation of chronic heart failure
ARF: Acute Renal Failure; Acute Respiratory Failure
BEACOPP: bleomycin, etoposide, adriamycin, cyclophosphamide, vincristine, carbazine, prednisone
BPSD: behavioral and psychological symptoms of dementia
CTCAE: Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events
DSM-5: The Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders, Fifth Edition
DTaP-IPV: diphtheria and tetanus toxoids with acellular pertussis and inactivated polio vaccine
DTwP: diphtheria and tetanus toxoids with whole cell pertussis vaccine
ECOGPS: Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Performance Status
Eshort: hort repetition technique based on echo
FEV1: forced expiratory volume in one second
FIGO: International Federation of Gynaecology and Obstetrics
FNCLCC: French Federation of Comprehensive Cancer Centers
Fshort: short repetition technique based on free induction decay
GCTTS: giant cell tumor of tendon sheath
GRASS: gradient - recalled acquisition in the steady state
HASTE: half acquisition single shot turbo spin echo
HEENT: head, eyes, ears, nose, and throat
HELLP: hemolysis, elevated liver enzymes, and low platelet count
HNSCC: head and neck squamous cell cancer
HSE: local injection of hypertonic saline-epinephrine solution
ICD-10: International Classification of Diseases, Tenth Revision
ICD-9: International Classification of Diseases, Ninth Revision
ICD-9-CM: International Classification of Diseases, Ninth Revision, Clinical Modification
ICSD-2: International Classification of Sleep Disorders, Second Edition
ICSD-3: International Classification of Sleep Disorders, Third Edition
ISHLT: The International Society for Heart & Lung Transplantation
ISUP: The International Society of Urological Pathology
JOMAC: judgement, orientation, memory, abstract thinking, and calculation
KCO: diffusing capacity for carbon monoxide per unit of alveolar volume
MCH: mean corpuscular hemoglobin (= mean cell hemoglobin)
MCHC: mean corpuscular hemoglobin concentration (= mean cell hemoglobin concentration)
MCV: mean corpuscular volume (= mean cell volume)
MMRV: measles, mumps, rubella and varicella vaccine
MPGR: multiplanar gradient - recalled acquisition in the steady state
NIHSS: National Institute of Health Stroke Scale
NKFDA: no known food and drug allergies
NYHAFC: New York Heart Association Functional Class
OPLL: ossification of the posterior longitudinal ligament
PaCO2: arterial partial pressure of carbon dioxide
POEMS: polyneuropathy, organomegaly, endocrinopathy, M-protein, and skin changes
PPPROM: prolonged preterm premature rupture of membranes
PSIMV+PS: pressure-synchronized intermittent mandatory ventilation + pressure support
PUNLMP: papillary urothelial neoplasm of low malignant potential
PUPPP: pruritic urticarial papules and plaques of pregnancy
QIDACHS: four times daily, before meals and before bedtime
qidachs: four times daily, before meals and before bedtime
QIDPCHS: four times daily, after meals and before bedtime
qidpchs: four times daily, after meals and before bedtime
QODOM: every other day, in the morning
RAMFAST: rapid acquisition matrix Fourier-acquired steady state
RBD: rapid eye movement sleep behavior disorder
RECIST: Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors
RV/TLC: residual volume divided by total lung capacity
SIMV+PS: synchronized intermittent mandatory ventilation + pressure support
STAT6: signal transducers and activators of transcription 6
STERF: steady state technique with refocused free induction decay
Tdap: tetanus toxoid, reduced diphtheria toxoid and acellular pertussis vaccine
Tdap-IPV: tetanus toxoid, reduced diphtheria toxoid, acellular pertussis and inactivated polio vaccine
TOCC: travel, occupation, contact, and cluster history
TOF-MRA: time of flight magnetic resonance angiography
TORCH: toxoplasmosis, rubella, cytomegalovirus, and herpes simplex virus
UNSCEAR: United Nations Scientific Committee on the Effects of Atomic Radiation
